task_summary: Pick the white plate and place it onto the red plate.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base xArm must grasp a shallow white plate from the table and place it accurately on top of a red plate target. The scene shows both plates on a green tabletop with ample clearance. The behavior prioritizes reliable perception, careful approach, stable grasp, safe transfer, and gentle placement with a brief press and release, followed by retreat to a safe height. Timing values are binned; motions use an above-target waypoint to avoid collisions.
preconditions: White plate and red plate are on the table and visible to the camera
Gripper calibrated and able to open to 0.09 m
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the white plate.
Compute a rim grasp, move above it, align precisely, and execute the pick.
Detect the red plate and set the place pose key.
Move above the red plate, lower until contact, press and place.
Open gripper to release and retreat to a safe distance.
success_criteria: White plate lifted securely without slip
White plate centered on the red plate after release
No collisions with table or fixtures
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-run DetectObject or widen search pattern
Grasp failure or slip: reopen, realign, recompute grasp, and retry pick
Contact too early while placing: retreat slightly and re-approach
Target not found: operator intervention or reinitialization
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release on the red plate and retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open before approaching the white plate.
Compute grasp pose for the white plate rim.
Move to a safe pregrasp height above the white plate.
Align precisely to the computed grasp pose.
Close and lift to pick the white plate.
Locate the red plate target for placement.
Store placement pose key for the red plate center.
Move above the red plate to a safe placing height.
Lower until contact is detected on the red plate.
Press the plate into place at the red plate center.
Retreat to a safe distance after placement.

failure_modes: Object detection fails due to glare
recovery_strategy: Reopen, reposition, and attempt pick again
Retreat slightly and redo place sequence
assumptions: Frames show the white plate lifted and later positioned near the red plate; the red circular item is interpreted as the placement target.
Grasp uses a pinch strategy on the plate rim; suction not assumed.
Placement uses gentle press (10.0) then release.

expected_success_criteria: White plate ends centered on red plate without wobble
No collisions or excessive force events
